Akkasah: Photography Archive (NYU Abu Dhabi)
Sommerreise in den Nahen Osten (Summer Trip to the Near East)
Fischer, Paul
AD.MC.042
130 Photographic Prints The album measures album 26 x 26 cm, each photograph around 7.7 x 10.5cm. Photographs all in good condition, a few are missing. The album has damage to the spine but not to the binding.
August 1966 An album of 130 images taken during a trip through Lebanon, Syria, Jordan and Palestine in August 1966. Images are focussed on historical and religious sites, the final few pages appear to be taken in Germany.
The album was compiled by Paul Fischer. Fischer was a (German) soldier in World War I who worked on the Berlin–Baghdad railway (Bagdadbahn) for the firm Philipp Holzmann (Frankfurt am Main). After World War I he was a prisoner of war (Kriegsgefangener) in Turkey, after his release and back in Germany he married Anna Liebing (maiden name) in 1.10.1927. He died in East Germany. 042
Content Description
An album of 130 images taken during a trip through Lebanon, Syria, Jordan and Palestine in August 1966. Images are focussed on historical and religious sites, including Beiteddine Palace, Baalbek, the Umayyad Mosque, Dome of the Rock, Al-Aqsa Mosque, walls of Jerusalem and Abbey of the Dormition. There are also views of markets, buildings, landscapes and local populations. The final few pages appear to be taken in Germany.
Biographical / Historical
The album was compiled by Paul Fischer. Fischer was a (German) soldier in World War I. From 1916-1919 he wporked as an Eisenbahn-Pionier. In this time he worked on the Berlin–Baghdad railway (Bagdadbahn) for the firm Philipp Holzmann (Frankfurt am Main). After World War I he was a prisoner of war (Kriegsgefangener) in Turkey, after his release and back in Germany he married Anna Liebing (maiden name) in 1.10.1927 and lived in Penig, Saxony. Later he worked at the Adolph Oeser, Maschinenfabrik in Leipzig, until 1940. Between 1941-1945 he worked in the Getriebewerk (transmission plant) in Penig. He died in East Germany.
Arrangement
Collection was processed in order that it was recieved
Conditions Governing Access
No restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
NYU Abu Dhabi holds all copyright and related rights pertaining to this collection. Please contact Akkasah Photography Archive at akkasah@nyu.edu for information regarding reproduction and use.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Acquired from Frank Schulze, Heimstättenstraße 43 09217 Burgstädt/Herrenhaide E-Mail: don-knarf@web.de Fax: 03724/668598 Tel.: 0173/3511052. Prior provenance unknown.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Album: Travels in the Middle East; AD_MC_042; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes.
